events.message: Filed a claim after a collision involving my car and another vehicle at the intersection, causing front-end damage.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after review of the submitted preliminary details and accident report.
An agent has been assigned to my case to assist with the automobile collision claim and guide me through the process.
Received confirmation that the insurance company has officially acknowledged the accident claim and begun processing.
The insurer requested additional documents including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and medical bills related to the accident.
All requested documents were submitted on time, including the police report and detailed repair estimates for my car’s damage.
The insurance company has started a detailed investigation to verify the facts of the collision and the extent of vehicle damage.
Investigation into the auto accident has been completed, confirming liability and validating the submitted damages.
A settlement offer has been proposed to cover repair costs and other damages resulting from the collision involving my vehicle.
Provided positive feedback on the insurer’s handling of the claim and the clarity of communications during the process.
Received official approval for the claim after documentation and investigation verified all damages from the auto accident.
Payment for the approved repair and injury costs was issued promptly following claim approval for the vehicle accident.
The claim case was officially closed, marking the successful conclusion of settlement and payment for the car collision.
All records and documents related to the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference and compliance requirements.
